CHAPTER VI

THE CHRIST-LIFE

As the sun seems to us to stand at mid-day between east and west, but in reality is only related to east and west in that we know thern by means of our path around it, so the Christ stands midway between separatism and indifferentism. In trying to understand why he dealt with each of these as he did, we need first to seek what dim knowledge may be open to us of the way in which the human mind of Jesus must have worked toward that divine insight into our manifold life from which his gospel sprang.
